messages: 23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (14:50): is there a way to make gvim go fullscreen?
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (14:51): so i dont need to see all the top bar with _ [] X
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (14:57): it isnt. that is why it was almost funny.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (14:58): Meriwether: did you read my question
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (14:58): What didn't I understand about it?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (14:58): <qamar> is there a way to make gvim go fullscreen?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (14:59): My wm goes fullscreen with alt-spacebar X.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (14:59): But then, you didn't say what wm y'r using.
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (14:59): Which is what made your answer almost funny.
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (15:01): Calling either Windows of metacity a wm *is* funny.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:01): like for example with gnome-terminal if you hit F11 it removes the toolbar with the lowering, resizing and closing buttons
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:02): what is the difference  between S and cc ?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:02): I've never used a unix WM that didn't allow you to hotmap the max key-combo.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:02): S is a synonym for cc
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:04): Meriwether: for example in firefox if you it F11 it goes fullscreen, gvim doesnt have this feature does it?
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:05): i recently dissabled that in my xorg.conf though
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (15:05): qamar: What's wrong with normal maximizing?
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:06): deryni: do you have girl friend?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:06): Do we have to go HERE?
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (15:07): Which isn't an answer to my question.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:07): deryni: nah it just looks very clumsy, it distracts me

7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:07): I want to know more about register (how to put stuff into register, cycle throught it...). but :help register is about becoming a registered user. What word should I use ?
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (15:08): qamar: Which top bar? The metacity one with the max/min buttons?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:08): qamar: If you want pretty, get a Mac.
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (15:08): roxy_: There might be a more complete place to look, but I don't know where offhand.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:09): deryni: the one with min/max/close, but nevermind i just use a full screen gnome-terminal
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:09): Meriwether: will you buy me one?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:09): qamar: You are the one bitching about pretty, not me.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:10): i would like one of those Sgi fridges
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:10): So you prefer noisy and hot to ugly?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:11): Not on the electric bill, tho.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:12): They are UGLY on the PG&E bill.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:12): Not to mention that the noise gon' scare away the girlies.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:13): Meriwether: are you going to port linux to the nintendo Wii
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:21): in Emacs, I can C-<space> to mark a place in a buffer and then M-w to place in the register the region between mark and cursor. How can I do that is vim ?
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:22): There are about 10 ways to do that in vim.
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:23): Meriwether: in emacs too, but ma for mark is something I can remember :-)
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:23): that will do it for the moment
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:23): good name for a movie, "10 ways to do it in vim"
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:27): I am not getting it. y'a bring me to beginning of line.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:27): "Mark 5" is a good name for a racing car
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:28): roxy_: Hit "p" afterward to see the results.
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:30): Meriwether: It didn't put it in the register
7e54395f8722e8891423286e00d838ba (15:31): and what is put when doing p
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:32): If you don't see it in register ", then you are doing something wrong.
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:32): Also, keep in mind that y'a works in line-wise mode.
9d0f43015966afbd4be3c3188b11e941 (15:34): it should put it into the "" register
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:36): Actually p = put, in vim terminology.
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:37): Meriwether: i was doing find and replaice and it hanged for a sec and crashed
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:37): See if you can crash it again.

23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:43): Meriwether: like for example make a file with a .cpp extension and enable highlighting code, now write soemthing and then try to search and find for a couple things that arnt in the file. The error messages will be like plaiced after each other instead of removing the old error message and after a while it just freezes and crashes
23b1b84c97fbd27aa1c36f06501d49c0 (15:44): so i think the problem is with the error messages not being replaced but being stacked up
24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (15:44): qamar: If you can predictably crash vim, you should get a test case together and submit a bug.

cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (15:50): pikapikapika: Well, there's this omnicompletion

aaed6ab79fc860b713152448f6bdb47c (16:02): does anyone know why the windows vim installer creates two seemingly redundant directories vim70 & vimfiles?
4c82176393abe7e4d2db0465a5f416d7 (16:03): pikapikapika: So does the makefile on assorted unixen as well.
4c82176393abe7e4d2db0465a5f416d7 (16:04): It just happens to place convenient symlinks in $PREFIX/bin/
